Package au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.context

Interface ResourceResolver

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseResourceResolver, DefaultResourceResolver, SingleResourceResolver
public interface ResourceResolver
Interface for resolving FHIR resources during FHIRPath evaluation.

The ResourceResolver is responsible for:

  • Providing access to the subject resource (the primary resource being queried)
  • Resolving references to other resources
  • Handling forward and reverse resource joins
  • Creating the underlying dataset view for query execution

Implementations of this interface manage the association of requested resource collection with the underlying representation in the Spark dataset which is essential for evaluating FHIRPath expressions that traverse resource boundaries.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • resolveSubjectResource

      @Nonnull ResourceCollection resolveSubjectResource()
      Resolves the subject resource for this context.

      The subject resource is the primary resource type being queried, such as Patient in a query starting with Patient.name.given.

      Returns:
      A ResourceCollection representing the subject resource

    • resolveResource

      @Nonnull Optional<ResourceCollection> resolveResource(@Nonnull String resourceCode)
      Resolves a resource by its type code.

      This method is used to access resources by their type name, such as "Patient" or "Observation".

      Parameters:
      resourceCode - The FHIR resource type code (e.g., "Patient", "Observation")
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the ResourceCollection if the resource type exists, or empty if it doesn't

    • createView

      @Nonnull Dataset<Row> createView()
      Creates the underlying dataset view for query execution.

      This method returns the Spark Dataset that contains the data for the subject resource and any joined resources. It's used as the starting point for evaluating FHIRPath expressions.

      Returns:
      A Spark Dataset containing the view data
